ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to continue my knowledge of Mandarin
Advanced my level of Chinese speaking, listening, reading, and writing.
I improved and became more fluent in Chinese

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths:
- well-organized
- covered a lot of material
- I enjoyed learning more about Chinese culture this semester and doing the project instead of the standard oral presentation

Weaknesses:
- I felt less comfortable with Chinese and my progress than I did in Chinese 110
- I didn't feel that the one on one tutoring was helpful
Each student is encouraged to participate, which helps everybody learn together! I really liked this format for the course.
The course is very fast-paced which can be difficult to keep up with sometimes as certain aspects like pronunciation take time and practice.
Strengths: clear syllabus, good pacing, clear teaching

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you really are passionate about Chinese and are willing to put in the time and energy required.
If a student is looking to improve Chinese then I would recommend this course
Chinese 120 is amazing! You learn so much about Chinese grammars that take you beyond level 1
